<summary>Hydatid cyst disease is a zoonotic disease caused by the larval stage of the Echinococcus granulosus parasite. It affects canines, herbivores, and humans, with canines being the final host. The disease is common in regions where animal husbandry is prevalent, such as Iran. The study aimed to determine the epidemiological and clinical status of human hydatidosis in Khorasan Razavi province during 2011-14. The majority of cases were women, rural, and housewives. The most common symptom was abdominal pain, with liver involvement being the most common. Risk factors included contact with dogs and improper vegetable washing. The disease is prevalent in various regions of Iran and can have a high health and economic burden.</summary>
